places.description: Take a stroll along the famous harbor

places.name: Kyoto

places.description: Step back in time in the Gion district

places.name: Kenya
places.title: Tsavo East National Park
places.description: Named after the Tsavo River, and opened in April 1984, Tsavo East National Park is one of the oldest parks in Kenya. It is located in the semi-arid Taru Desert.

places.name: Kenya
places.title: Nairobi
places.description: Dubbed the Safari Capital of the World

places.name: South Korea
places.title: Seoul
places.description: This modern city is a traveler’s dream

homestays.name: Maldives
homestays.title: Stay among the atolls in
homestays.description: From the 2nd century AD, the islands were known as the 'Money Isles' due to the abundance of cowry shells, a currency of the early ages.

homestays.name: Morocco
homestays.title: Experience the Ourika Valley in
homestays.description: Morocco’s Hispano-Moorish architecture blends influences from Berber culture, Spain, and contemporary artistic currents in the Middle East.

homestays.name: Mongolia
homestays.title: Live traditionally in
homestays.description: Traditional Mongolian yurts consists of an angled latticework of wood or bamboo for walls, ribs, and a wheel.

cities.title: Hotel Kaneyamaen and Bessho SASA
cities.description: Located at the base of Mount Fuji, Hotel Kaneyamaen is a traitional japanese ryokan with a modern twist. Enjoy a private onsen bath and a private multi-course kaiseki dinner.

cities.title: HOTEL THE FLAG 大阪市
cities.description: Make a stop in Osaka and stay at HOTEL THE FLAG, just a few minutes walk to experience the food culture surrounding Dontonbori. Just one minute away is the Shinsaibashi shopping street.

cities.title: 9 Hours Shinjuku
cities.description: Experience a truly unique stay in an authentic Japanese capsule hotel. 9 Hours Shinjuku is minutes from one of Japan’s busiest train stations. Just take the NEX train from Narita airport!
